definition: to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: One day, I made an appointment with Wang Ping togo to the bookstore together on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 一天，我和王萍相约周日一路去书店。

sentences.english: Therefore, Jay and David said goodbye to each other and promised to get together again on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 因此，阿杰跟戴维彼此告别，并相约周六再见。

sentences.english: If I see you next to never , how can we say forever.
sentences.chinese: 假如你不能再回还，岂能相约永相爱。

sentences.english: Today we met at the bus stop early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 今日一大早，咱们相约在车站晤面。

sentences.english: Meet us next week at the same time Ucar Black English.
sentences.chinese: 我们下星期的同一时间相约乌卡黑皮英语。

sentences.english: Senators Wilson and Howard paired off on the revenue bill.
sentences.chinese: 参议员威尔逊和霍华德相约不参加对税收案的投票。

sentences.english: Meet sister and I went to the fields and found the spring in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 我又和妹妹相约来到田野，发现春在田野里。

sentences.english: The carrying amount of other payables and accruals approximates to its fair value.
sentences.chinese: 其他应付款项及应计费用的帐面值与其公平值相约。

sentences.english: We invited two friends along to celebrate this day at one of the seafood restaurant in Dockland, Melbourne.
sentences.chinese: 相约了两位朋友在墨尔本沿港口的餐厅吃晚餐。

sentences.english: Slowly, young women trickled in to take a look.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地，一些年轻的女生相约而来，想探个究竟。

sentences.english: Ordinary bridal salon have tried the service free, they can make an appointment on weekdays.
sentences.chinese: 普通婚纱店试过免费服务，他们会相约在平日。

sentences.english: Proximity to the sea, similar to photography lovers here is Viiv.
sentences.chinese: 背靠大海，相约来这里照相的情侣们是欢跃的。

sentences.english: First, let us first for us to Meet at the Dragon warm applause.
sentences.chinese: 首先让我们先为我们能够相约在龙腾热烈的鼓掌。

sentences.english: Wei claimed he had arranged with Xu to commit suicide together and he failed to kill himself.
sentences.chinese: 魏磊则声称两人是相约自杀，而自己自杀未遂。

sentences.english: After the sea-ship, after the whistling winds.
sentences.chinese: 相约海船后，笛风微入我喉。

sentences.english: Make an appointment in weekend before after the work and spend holidays to southern Florida.
sentences.chinese: 相约在工作后的周末前往南方佛罗里达度假。

definition: to meet together/to assemble
to go with sb/to form companionships
joint participation/to go together
to meet together
to see each other/to meet in person
to meet by chance/to run into sb/chance encounter
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to drink and chat merrily (idiom)
to confide in each other (idiom)
to keep an appointment
to get together socially/to celebrate/party/celebration
in the same place/together/with/altogether (in total)
to meet/to see each other/CL:次[ci4]
lit. Even if we don't see each other, don't give up and leave (idiom)/fig. Be sure to wait!/See you there!
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
